35b5b9c2-e331-4094-b15e-05e7729e3948.description: The RBLP-T certification is for senior leaders. Organizational learning makes change possible and enables competitive advantage. Senior leaders support the organization’s ability to learn by analyzing organizational learning capacity, promoting a shared vision, fostering knowledge emergence, and ensuring knowledge diffusion. Senior leaders that earn the RBLP-T certification are able to train and prepare others to sit for the RBLP series of leadership certification exams.
35b5b9c2-e331-4094-b15e-05e7729e3948.name: Resilience-Building Leadership Professional Trainer (RBLP-T)

alignments.name: Create a Positive Climate Competency Domain
alignments.description: Create a Positive Climate Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze team climate. Task 2: Earn trust. Task 3: Treat people with respect. Task 4: Enforce accountability. Task 5: Encourage people to have fun. Task 6: Demonstrate character. Task 7: Manage expectations.

alignments.name: Develop Cohesion Competency Domain
alignments.description: Develop Cohesion Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze team cohesion. Task 2: Organize people to work in teams. Task 3: Promote trust between team members. Task 4: Ensure mutual respect between team members. Task 5: Train the team. Task 6: Manage expectations. Task 7: Talk about setbacks.

alignments.name: Provide Purpose Competency Domain
alignments.description: Provide Purpose Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze individual purpose. Task 2: Show genuine concern for people. Task 3: Encourage individual learning Task 4: Delegate responsibility. Task 5: Empower decision-making. Task 6: Keep people focused on the mission. Task 7: Be there when the going gets tough.

alignments.name: Facilitate Team Learning Competency Domain
alignments.description: Facilitate Team Learning Leader Tasks -Task 1: Analyze team learning capacity. Task 2: Orient on team goals. Task 3: Encourage constructive dialogue. Task 4: Build new mental models.

alignments.name: Support Organizational Learning Competency Domain
alignments.description: Support Organizational Learning Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze organizational learning capacity. Task 2: Promote a shared vision. Task 3: Foster knowledge emergence. Task 4: Ensure knowledge diffusion.

badge_template_activities.title: Applicants for RBLP-T certification must be currently serving in a senior leader role or have previously served in a senior leader role. Senior leaders are responsible for cross-functional objectives and results. They may provide guidance and direction to one or more middle managers. Senior leaders support organizational learning and change. They develop and implement strategies to achieve the organization’s vision. Senior leaders have substantial relevant expertise and experience.

Complete a Building and Leading Resilient Teams certificate, coaching, training, or development program consisting of 42 hours of student preparation and 21 contact hours of instructor-led group discussion, or 7 contact hours of one-on-one coaching. The programs offered by our education and training partners meet or exceed this requirement.

During the 3.5-hour oral RBLP-T certification exam, the applicant is required to show the competence of factual (what), conceptual (why), and procedural (how) knowledge in each of the following competency domains: Create Positive Climate, Develop Cohesion, Provide Purpose, Facilitate Team Learning, and Support Organizational Learning.

Recertification is required every three years to maintain the RBLP-T level of certification. Certification holders are required to complete a recertification application and professional development exercise detailing how they have implemented applicable leader tasks in the workplace during the previous three years.

4bef7229-35d4-4582-ac8a-9b381da6d44f.description: The RBLP-C certification is for middle managers. Solving problems and overcoming challenges is a learning process. Middle managers facilitate the team’s ability to learn by analyzing team learning capacity, orienting on team goals, encouraging constructive dialogue, and building new mental models. Middle managers that earn the RBLP-C certification are able to coach their front-line supervisors to build and lead resilient teams.
4bef7229-35d4-4582-ac8a-9b381da6d44f.name: Resilience-Building Leadership Professional Coach (RBLP-C)

alignments.name: Create a Positive Climate Competency Domain
alignments.description: Create a Positive Climate Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze team climate. Task 2: Earn trust. Task 3: Treat people with respect. Task 4: Enforce accountability. Task 5: Encourage people to have fun. Task 6: Demonstrate character. Task 7: Keep the team informed.

alignments.name: Develop Cohesion Competency Domain
alignments.description: Develop Cohesion Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze team cohesion. Task 2: Organize people to work in teams. Task 3: Promote trust between team members. Task 4: Ensure mutual respect between team members. Task 5: Train the team. Task 6: Manage expectations. Task 7: Talk about setbacks.

alignments.name: Provide Purpose Competency Domain
alignments.description: Provide Purpose Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze individual purpose. Task 2: Show genuine concern for people. Task 3: Encourage individual learning Task 4: Delegate responsibility. Task 5: Empower decision-making. Task 6: Keep people focused on the mission. Task 7: Be there when the going gets tough.

alignments.name: Facilitate Team Learning Competency Domain
alignments.description: Facilitate Team Learning Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze team learning capacity. Task 2: Orient on team goals. Task 3: Encourage constructive dialogue. Task 4: Build new mental models.

badge_template_activities.title: Applicants for RBLP-C certification must be currently serving in a middle manager role or have previously served in a middle manager role. Middle managers are responsible for objectives and results in a functional department. They may provide guidance and direction to one or more front-line supervisors. Middle managers facilitate team learning and problem-solving. They establish goals for their teams and monitor progress. Middle managers have significant relevant expertise and experience.

Complete a Building and Leading Resilient Teams certificate, coaching, training, or development program consisting of 42 hours of student preparation and 21 contact hours of instructor-led group discussion, or 7 contact hours of one-on-one coaching. The programs offered by our education and training partners meet or exceed this requirement.

During the 2.5-hour oral RBLP-C certification exam, the applicant is required to show competence of factual (what), conceptual (why), and procedural knowledge (how) in each of the following competency domains: Develop Cohesion Create a Positive Climate Provide Purpose and Facilitate Team Learning.

Recertification is required every three years to maintain the RBLP-C level of certification. Certification holders are required to complete a recertification application and professional development exercise detailing how they have implemented applicable leader tasks in the workplace during the previous three years.

ae68db1b-58f5-4d7f-90ba-d8ceb89b32fe.description: The RBLP certification is for front-line supervisors. Collective resilience is the ability to overcome adversity, and then adapt and grow because of that adversity. Resilient teams are stronger together and they make learning and change possible. Front-line supervisors build and lead resilient teams by creating a positive climate, developing cohesion, and providing purpose.
ae68db1b-58f5-4d7f-90ba-d8ceb89b32fe.name: Resilience-Building Leadership Professional (RBLP)

alignments.name: Create a Positive Climate Competency Domain
alignments.description: Create a Positive Climate Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze team climate. Task 2: Earn trust. Task 3: Treat people with respect. Task 4: Enforce accountability. Task 5: Encourage people to have fun. Task 6: Demonstrate character. Task 7: Keep the team informed.

alignments.name: Develop Cohesion Competency Domain
alignments.description: Develop Cohesion Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze team cohesion. Task 2: Organize people to work in teams. Task 3: Promote trust between team members. Task 4: Ensure mutual respect between team members. Task 5: Train the team. Task 6: Manage expectations. Task 7: Talk about setbacks.

alignments.name: Provide Purpose Competency Domain
alignments.description: Provide Purpose Leader Tasks - Task 1: Analyze individual purpose. Task 2: Show genuine concern for people. Task 3: Encourage individual learning Task 4: Delegate responsibility. Task 5: Empower decision-making. Task 6: Keep people focused on the mission. Task 7: Be there when the going gets tough.

badge_template_activities.title: RBLP applicants must be currently serving in a front-line supervisor role. Front-line supervisors provide guidance and direction to workers. They set priorities for workers and oversee their activities. Front-line supervisors organize people to work in teams and may work alongside subordinates as a member of the team. They monitor performance and enforce policies, rules, and regulations. Front-line supervisors have applicable technical expertise and can provide on-the-job training to workers.

Complete a Building and Leading Resilient Teams certificate, coaching, training, or development program consisting of 42 hours of student preparation and 21 contact hours of instructor-led group discussion, or 7 contact hours of one-on-one coaching. The programs offered by our education and training partners meet or exceed this requirement.

During the 1.5-hour oral RBLP certification exam, the applicant is required to show competence of factual (what), conceptual (why), and procedural knowledge (how) in each of the following competency domains: Create a Positive Climate. Develop Cohesion, and Provide Purpose

Recertification is required every three years to maintain the RBLP level of certification. Certification holders are required to complete a recertification application and professional development exercise detailing how they have implemented applicable leader tasks in the workplace during the previous three years.

cfd773f7-4104-46a2-ae59-70e5b357f6e7.description: RBLP Investors have purchased non-voting common stock in Resilience-Building Leader Program Inc. via the StartEngine equity crowdfunding platform. They are eligible to participate in RBLP quarterly investor update webinars with live CEO Q&A.
cfd773f7-4104-46a2-ae59-70e5b357f6e7.name: RBLP Investor

badge_template_activities.title: RBLP Investor has purchased non-voting common stock in Resilience-Building Leader Program Inc.

b490a059-3f9d-404a-9e3b-c11fc3635d8d.description: An Authorized Training Partner (ATP) is a workforce training and development company that teaches the Building and Leading Resilient Teams curriculum. These programs prepare clients/students for the Resilience-Building Leadership Professional™ (RBLP™) series of leadership certification exams. ATP qualifications are verified annually by the Resilience-Building Leader Program.
b490a059-3f9d-404a-9e3b-c11fc3635d8d.name: Authorized Training Partner

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate alignment with Resilience-Building Leader Program mission, purpose, and vision.
Adhere to Resilience-Building Leader Program brand, copyright, and trademark guidelines and policies.
Ensure coaching and training programs are facilitated by current RBLP-T certification holders.
Use curriculum designed and developed by Resilience-Building Leader Program.
Ensure students complete curriculum-mandated prep hours and contact hours based on program delivery modality.
Demonstrate capability to collect feedback from students and implement improvements as required.

90d38c25-8f5b-425a-adaf-7950eedf1f4f.description: An Authorized Education Partner (AEP) is a college or university that teaches the Building and Leading Resilient Teams curriculum. These programs prepare students for the Resilience-Building Leadership Professional™ (RBLP™) series of leadership certification exams. AEP qualifications are verified annually by the Resilience-Building Leader Program.
90d38c25-8f5b-425a-adaf-7950eedf1f4f.name: Authorized Education Partner

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate alignment with Resilience-Building Leader Program mission, purpose, and vision.
Adhere to Resilience-Building Leader Program brand, copyright, and trademark guidelines and policies.
Ensure certificate programs are facilitated by current RBLP-T credential holders.
Use curriculum designed and developed by Resilience-Building Leader Program.
Ensure students complete curriculum-mandated prep hours and contact hours based on program delivery modality.
Demonstrate capability to collect feedback from students and implement improvements as required.
